bestBHT.bht: The mention of the son of Arni in this passage is more reliable than the alternate option of the son of Aram, as evidenced by the connections to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.

Philip Schaff: Luke 3:33. The son of Arni. This is better established than: ‘the son of Aram.’ Still the latter agrees with Rth 4:18 ; 1 Chronicles 2:9; Matthew 1:3-4.

bhtAttempts.bht: Luke 3:33 is a verse that mentions the son of Arni. This is better established than the alternative possibility of the son of Aram. The connection to Arni is supported by references to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.
The mention of the son of Arni in this passage is more reliable than the alternate option of the son of Aram, as evidenced by the connections to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.

The son of Arni mentioned in Luke 3:33 is a more reliable understanding compared to the alternative son of Aram. This conclusion finds support from the references to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.

The inclusion of the son of Arni in this verse is considered to be more trustworthy than the alternative mention of the son of Aram. This assertion is substantiated by the references to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.

The mention of the son of Arni in this particular passage is regarded as a more reliable interpretation as opposed to the son of Aram. This conclusion is further supported by the references to Ruth 4:18, 1 Chronicles 2:9, and Matthew 1:3-4.
